description: Great food and low key concept.  Salmon platter w/goat cheese is great.  The daily specials are fantastic.  The pork w/rice was the best pork I've eaten.
author: Alf O.

description: Incredibly fresh food, creatively crafted with love. I can't get enough of this place, and go there as often as humanly possible.
author: Jen O.

description: Good solid lunch plate options, though pricey, probably on par with everything around this neighborhood. Like their changing menu everyday and relaxed cafeteria style. They even have cut up limes at the self-serve water station. Not too much pastry options but offers paleo-muffins the few times I visited. After lunch, they change to afternoon menu, such as cheese plates, etc.
author: Stephanie L.

description:
Don't let the line scare you away. "It moves quickly." I was assured, and sure enough, it did. So the line is due to the menu of fresh ingredients which changes daily. The day I was there, all items were Mexican inspired, with a chicken, pork, and vegetarian choice. The line moves quickly because the food choices are limited to three plated dishes each day. You can deviate from the set choices, or you can add a la carte items. They will also box your choice nicely if you are one of those local high-tech workers who barely has enough time to grab lunch. They only take credit/debit cards, so they have swiping down. Within a few minutes of getting in line, you're sure to have your food.

The portion size was good for lunch. Since the menu changes daily, critiquing the individual items doesn't seem productive. What I will say is that in my group of six, all three offerings were covered, and all three got rave reviews.

The ambience is trendy and friendly. Since we got there near the end of lunch, a few of us went back after lunch for desserts. They don't make the pastries there, but have a high-quality local baker who supplies them daily - all were yummy. We also had well-made coffee.

There seem to be a number of places popping up in this neighborhood, but Picnic on Third has a great model. Somewhere in-between cafeteria service and high-quality sit down food. Seems to me to be a great recipe for success.
author: MaryFran L.

description:
Went there for brunch and really appreciated the food. 
They prepared two exquisite combinations of ingredients: slow cooked pork with polenta, and smoke salmon scramble with asparagus. 
We could taste the freshness of the ingredients.
author: Theo F.

description:
Small but well chosen menu (which will change every day), of simply DELICIOUS food ... 

I was very skeptical about roasted okra -- that is not my favorite vegetable and it can be a slimy mess -- but it was really great.  

Everything was perfectly seasoned; perfectly cooked.  We will definitely be back.

OH -- bring your credit/debit card -- looks like they don't take cash at all.
author: Jaina S.

description:
This place is alright.

I've been here a bunch of times, and I've really wanted to like it, but I just can't say that I've had anything I thought was delicious. 

To be fair, I've also never had anything I would say is bad. My usual criticism is that things are boring and lack flavor. The meals I've eaten here have looked/sounded much better than they ended up tasting. 

Bottom line, it's a convenient spot if you're in SoMa, and I'll still check it out when the menu looks good, but never my first choice.
author: Jonathan B.

description:
I dropped into Picnic on Third for the first time today while visiting my mother in the city. I've been dying to try it out since I first heard about it, but never had a chance to make my way up to the city until now. I was not the least bit disappointed or unsatisfied. I came in hungry and left full. An old friend and classmate I went to school with just opened Picnic on Third with a friend of hers, but let it be known that I don't let this bias influence my opinion. Anyone who knows me knows I'm highly opinionated and I don't mince my words.

I'm not a self-described "foodie" by most people's definition, although I like to think I am, so I'll jump straight to the point.

The menu changes daily and is centered around a theme, with a few different compositions available to satisfy the vegetable, meat, and seafood lovers. And we're not talking generic crap like a plate of spaghetti and marinara sauce or a bowl of chicken pho that you can get at any corner joint. It's true homestyle food that I'm sure would win over any gourmand. It's like the stuff your mother made for you at home, but with pizzazz, originality, and restaurant quality.

The staff is super friendly and always willing to help. The dining area and kitchen are super clean and spotless, even with how busy it can be during lunch. The environment is unique; somewhere between old American and 19th-century European ambiance, with neutral colors tastefully done and old-fashioned long-filament lights on the walls. I dig it. 

Only credit / debit cards are accepted. While I'm sure this may inconvenience some people, it's the opposite for me. I almost never carry cash, and San Francisco is riddled with restaurants that would rather shut down and file for chapter 7 than take your credit card, so this is a nice change.

I've been a type 1 diabetic since I was 19, so I drink tons of water. One of my biggest complaints with some restaurants is they don't refill my water very much or at all (though, to be fair, I'm like a camel for the aforementioned reason, so I'm usually lenient about this). But here, several carafes of fresh water sit on a table with a box of cups and a bowl of lemon slices so you can serve yourself as much as you want. A-okay with me!

But perhaps my biggest rave about Picnic on Third was its ability to take three foods I normally cannot stand - cornbread, chard, and carrots - and turn them into something delicious and enjoyable enough for me to return for seconds (provided I have enough of an appetite). I'll definitely return soon with friends. Places like this make me wish I lived much closer to San Francisco. It's a very refreshing change from all the Vietnamese, Mexican, Chinese, and sandwich restaurants that seemingly make up 90% of the Bay Area's dining establishments. But most importantly, it's original and delicious.
author: Niels M.

description:
Disappointing.  Had both lemon chicken and veggie lunch plates.  Only chicken was warm, all else cold including a filo dough type pizza bread and chunky fries that would have tasted far better warmed.  Presume their strategy is to stick to a rigid menu and serve it up quick.  Success on that mark.

Hummus did not include pita bread with which to scoop it up.   Portions are child sized.  2 dishes,  1 cider, tip,  =  almost $40.  Eating on tin plates for lunch, this is too expensive for such meager servings.
author: C R.

description:
As already stated, the food is good and ambiance is nice, but it's overpriced, especially compared to similar restaurants nearby (Darwin, various spots in South Park, HRD). I paid 7 dollars for three meatballs? 3 dollars for a scoop of some cold veggies that have been sitting out for 2 hours?

A tough one, I want to like this place and go more often, but as others have said, it's just across the 'overpriced' threshold that you're left wishing for a bit more (either in quality of fresh food, or realistically, larger portion sizes). If they came down to 10-11$ meals, they'd have 5 stars from everyone.

Simply put-- its hard to justify paying 13 or 14$ for glorified buffet food (nothing is prepped per order).
author: Wilson L.

description:
We're so excited this place is open. A reliable Gluten Free and Paleo friendly spot close to our house is just what we've always wanted (seriously). The food is good and reasonably priced and portioned, and you can order items a la cart (choose your protein, choose your veg). I've only picked up dinner, but I guess they do a good lunch/happy hour scene. 
Wish they were open later, so we could eat here more. Spoke with the kitchen staff for awhile when I was in and they assured there'd be no hidden gluten, and they even use Gluten Free Tamari (instead of Soy Sauce). 
Also, while I was there I dropped and spilled my Bok Choy and they gave me a new one, so that alone has earned a returning customer. In fact, I wonder what the menu is tomorrow...
author: Brooke R.

description:
Picnic on Third is a great addition to the neighborhood's lunch options! I stopped by for their soft opening and enjoyed friendly service, delicious espresso, fresh ingredients with a rotating menu, and all at a reasonable price. Love the camping/picnic themed plates and cups, and the chocolate cookie with a sea salt center was to die for. 

Will definitely be back!
author: Tory F.

description: Decided to go here for brunch on a Sunday morning at 11. Came in and there were only a few people. We ordered the two egg hash (4/5) and the scramble (3/5) with ingredients that change. Today's special ingredients were avocado, salmon, and asparagus. I wasn't that impressed with the scramble since it was basically scrambled eggs topped with a couple pieces of salmon and some asparagus. I wish it had come with toast or something to make the meal a little more substantial. Positive was that the salmon was fresh and did not taste fishy at all. The two egg hash was a lot better. Loved the shredded roasted Brussel sprouts and aoili that came on the potatoes. Also got the fruit bowl and their iced Vietnamese coffee special with a grand total of $40. The Vietnamese iced coffee didn't have the depth of authentic iced coffee and tasted more creamy like blended coffee ice cream. Good, but just not what I was expecting. Overall, a good place with quality ingredients, smaller than normal brunch portions, and downtown upscale pricing.
author: Katy C.

description: Such a great concept and the food is always good. I couldn't decide between the two entrees one day and they made a great suggestion - want one of each? This place is like a high end cafeteria. Food is great, service is great. It's a small location, though, so you can find yourself without a seat. To-go is an excellent option.
author: M M.

description: Very unique homemade chai in this city! Creamy, lightly spicy, not overly sweet, kinda reminds me of pumpkin and fall. :) Staff are very friendly and welcoming. Apparently they've been open for a little over 3 months now, and their menu changes often to whatever the chef is so inspired to make. I definitely wanna stop by for a proper meal here one day. They also have an impressive array of spices on their wall (that do actually get used!).
author: Linus W.

description: Awesome concept - simple and elegant. Great service. The day I went, the pork was very salty. I am hoping to return to try some more dishes.
author: Howe L.

description:
HAVE I SERIOUSLY NOT REVIEWED THIS. 

When I went, they served me Egyptian-themed "pomegranate braised beef, mashed babaganoush with paprika oil, dukkah-crusted pumpkin wedges, and date chutney". I wanted to cry with how perfect the food was. It's a bit expensive, but oh my god, the food.... insanely good. 

Plus it changes all the time, you'll never be bored!
author: JoAnn C.

description:
Cute new place near work. I'm not much of a coffee drinker, but my coworker brought in a cup that had the most adorable awkward-looking octopus on it...I had to come in after seeing that. I'm here for the chai tea lattes. I've had it both hot and cold and it's excellent either way. I still prefer the one at TwoFish, but this is slightly closer and the food looks extra-tasty. I may stop by again for lunch if it isn't too busy. 

The problem with some cafes is that they have a small space and then fill it up too quickly...and since it's like a cafe, people don't...leave. For hours. Because they're talking. No lack of stars against that, of course; I just wonder about things like that sometimes.

Anyway, the chai tea latte is excellent. I don't know much about coffee, but boy, it smelled good, and they seem to have a different coffee blend daily. Good place for grabbing some caffeine during the workday!
author: Robbin A.

description:
OK, this might sound weird, but I mean it in the best possible way: Picnic feels like a high end cafeteria (think eating at Google or Facebook or Square). It's very fast, relatively cheap and absolutely yummy. I really like that you only have a few options so you don't have to think, just point to one of the compositions of the day. All of their meals are healthy AND filling, what more can you ask for, really? The staff is very friendly and they bus the tables. 

I only have a couple of minor grips with it: it's quite loud and their extras (desserts, to-go jars of soup, etc.) are SO expensive, which has stopped me from getting them, so I don't know, maybe they are worth it?
author: Mathilde P.

description: Thought I would give this place a try. Decent food, not great, but edible. Is it worth my 18 dollars for a plate? NO. Will I return? Only if It's the only place open in the area and I was really hungry.
author: Eduardo A.

description:
Stopped here for lunch during a conference break...definitely worthwhile! Fresh, ever-changing menu made with high-quality, fresh ingredients. 

I had a delicious house made sausage with shaved fennel salad and roasted broccolini with Brussels sprouts. Apps, lunch, drinks for four was ~$80 with tip.
author: Scott W.

description: Delicious eggs and french toast! Expensive, but the food is quality and the ambience is cute.
author: Carissa G.

description:
This place is right near my office, so I find myself going in to keep my weekly lunchtime routine exciting. Each time I finish my lunch, I ask myself why I go back. The food is good, but way overpriced. I look at my carton (and I'm no greedy glutton) and remark at how little it all is. $7 for 3 chicken thighs? $3 for a scoop of bok choy? come on. 

Also, a side note: the people who work there act like they know everyone who walks in the door, which bothers me. I appreciate friendliness, but there is a fine line between friendly and over-assuming.
author: Hadley L.

description:
I cannot explain how much I love this place on a simple Yelp review.  

First off, the vibe itself is amazing.  Perfect first date place or to hangout with a friend you haven't seen in a while.  The decorations/interior design is aweome.  I stared around for like 5 minutes. 

Second off, staff is chill and friendly, not awkward and trying to oversell stuff.  I love their shirts.  

Third, the food is great - tastes like mom-cooked meal but a tad better because it's clearly unique recipies to whatever genius is behind the cooking.  10/10, bomb.com.  Glad they're here.  ^_^
author: Justin P.

description:
Great food with fresh ingredients; tastes home made and genuine, mostly inspired by Italian recipes.
Menu is small - three compositions are served for lunch - but extremely high quality. You can make your own composition using the same ingredients if you like.
The location is great and the place is newly remodeled, warm and cozy.
A bit on the pricey side for lunch (about $15), but feels like a treat and a nice break from the other places around South Park.
author: Cosimo C.

description: The staff are very friendly and courteous. But the kitchen does not seem very clean. And the food was mediocre. Sorta like overpriced cafeteria. I'm sorry to leave a bad review, but I dropped 50 dollars for very little food and a bit grossed out.
author: Grace P.

description: Love Picnic on Thrid!  Food is always fresh, delicious, and easy for all your dietary challenged friends.  YUM!
author: Nathan J.

description: Great healthy lunch, underrated and always easy to get a seat brunch. Nice proprietors. 5 star.
author: Joe B.

description:
I ate at picnic this Friday on the second day of the soft opening.  I had lamb with hummus and chard (you get to build your own meal from multiple choices: $6 for a main, $3 for side) so $12 for my whole meal which I thought was totally reasonable.  For reference - the same amount of food from the whole foods hot bar would have been around $15.

The lamb was awesomely savory and the hummus had whole chick peas in it which I thought was a nice touch.  The chard was great as well and I also got to taste some of my girlfriends choices (roasted chicken and cous cous) which was excellent - really crispy skin on the chicken which I appreciated.

The space is very clean and bright and has a relaxing atmosphere even when crowded, so I can definitely see myself spending my lunches here.

The menu changes daily so the experience is new every time. And I will definitely be back.
author: Chris H.

description:
If you need a root vegetable fix this is your place. Extremely well prepared meats and vegetable is a classic country style. You always get a great selection and the portions are great if you don't want to fall asleep after lunch or you have a variety of people wanting very different sized portions.

They have just enough selection each day to keep everyone in a large group lunch happy, but also they do everything to perfection, so the menu is appropriately limited. The day to day variety is incredibly so go early and often.

They also have a lovely selection of wine and beer to round everything out.
author: Geoff L.

description: I'm officially obsessed with this place.  Everything is super fresh and flavorful.  Menu changes daily with great options that are made of real food.  And their breakfast sandwich with bacon and house sauce is to die for.  Don't miss the strawberry lime agua fresca!
author: Paul B.

description:
We have been trying to make it out to picnic on third since they opened their doors. Walking in soaked from the rain, we were greeted and told the day's menu, to our surprise everything was amazing. The tongue was so tender and full of flavor, the chicken had a nice hint of ginger and I had a hard time trying to control myself from getting seconds. 
Both of our meals were amazing, I wish they would do breakfast, lunch and dinner!
author: Sasan J.

description: Very friendly service and delicious food. I got the roasted pork with corn pudding. The portion was huge! Definitely going back again!
author: Fiona J.

description: I like how they run this place. Their nice, presentation feels comforting, and they clean up after you.  Sausage and gravy needed salt, biscuit would seem to be better with jam and greens left not much of a memory. I would try this place again in hope I got WoWed from something but a third time I'll keep it pushing.
author: Hilary J.

description:
My boyfriend and I tried this place for the first time because we bought a gilt city coupon for a couple glasses of wine and a cheese plate. 

We got there around lunch and the girl working told us they don't usually do the cheese plates until later in the day but she would go get someone and she was sure they could get one together for us (It was unfortunate because the deal I bought never said anything about hours but I think thats more Gilt City's mistake) The manager/supervisor came right over and brought us up to the front and got us each our drinks and said she would get the cheese plate together right away - which she did. 

The staff here were very friendly and polite and made an awkward situation much better. We will definitely be back to try their lunch!
author: Amy W.

description: fantastic variety of fresh, somewhat healthy options. you can mix and match a protein with sides. interesting condiments too. the menu changes frequently but I'm not sure if is daily or weekly, I haven't been here more than once in a week. and the staff is super friendly which make the experience really nice. there aren't many tables inside, maybe a dozen, but it seems most people like to order to-go so I haven't had any problem getting a seat. definitely one of the better fresh-food places in SoMa
author: Bob U.

description:
Love Picnic! Great food with a kind staff. I send all my friends their way with great results. 

If you happen to be there for breakfast don't hesitate to try the pork and polenta!!!
author: Julia L.

description: Awesome food made by awesome people. We used Picnic to cater a lunch meeting in the office. All the big wigs were in attendance and they loved the food and service!
author: Benjamin R.

description:
Picnic started off strong, but lately the chef has been taking risks that maybe aren't paying off too well. What started as great, slow-cooked, simple comfort food with a gourmet twist has now become a grab-bag of attempts at random ethnic cuisine. Don't get me wrong, I love ethnic cuisine as much as anyone, but when I have Indian or Korean food, I want it to taste like Indian or Korean food, not a bland, one-note facsimile of it. San Francisco has plenty of authentic options, so there's not really a need for an "okay" copy.

What made this place shine in the beginning was tender, slow-cooked meals that you just couldn't get anywhere else. Who else in the city offers slow-braised beef or pork that's been going for hours and falls off the bone?

You've only been open three months--please don't lose your way already.

Plus, as others have said, the prices are a bit mad. I get it--premium ingredients demand a premium price. But maybe offer a smaller portion or something? I'm not saying the food's not good when they're having a good day, it's just that walking into a place and being served like you're on a lunch line doesn't really strike me as a premium experience.

But I guess they have to pay for those marble countertops somehow.
author: Will G.

description: Came here for brunch with the gilt deal. Really good creative brunch items (although the pork polenta dish was a bit salty). Disappointed in the mimosas which came in a pretty small carafe and tasted like mostly OJ. Would skip mimosas here!  Also unimpressed with the Vietnamese iced coffee which was very milk heavy.
author: Mana B.

description:
Had been eyeing this place with its cute interior for a while and finally stopped in today to give it a try.
I'm one of those people that has an extremely hard time choosing a dish, so I love the concept of this place for making it easy on me. They offer limited options (2 non veg dishes and one veg) with a menu that changes daily. I was actually a bit surprised about the menu, as I had expected lighter fare and today's choices were pretty hearty comfort dishes. May not be like this every day though, I'll have to go back and see what else they feature on their menu. 
I went for the turkey meatloaf and chose a side of green beans and Brussels sprouts. They also offer combination meals that come with a protein, a starch and a veggie. The food tasted like a home cooked meal, which is a nice change from standard lunch fare in SOMA. The cozy interior and homey foods will have me coming back for more.
author: Christina Z.

description: Splendid lunch.  Simple customer flow,  nice  personnel,  very good food and fair pricing.  Win.
author: Patrick H.

description:
I LOVE this restaurant!  I went twice while I was in San Fran visiting some friends and both times I had an A+ experience.  The food is amazingly yummy.  The staff is friendly and helpful.  The decor is casual and cozy.  

We went for lunch one day and then again for Sunday brunch.  Both meals were impressive.  Fresh ingredients, superbly seasoned.  And the food came out promptly.  

For brunch, the best French toast I've ever had.  At first I was scared by the small menu, but truly everything looked so good I couldn't decide.  Luckily, I was with a big group and we all shared so I was able to try everything!  

Side note:  the coffee is spectacular.  

Highly recommended!!!
author: Valary S.

description: Yummmmy. Tried all the brunch options and they were all great! Now convinced that all scrambles require breadcrumbs for texture. And it may be hard to do bad bacon but their bacon is on another level of carmelized deliciousness. Super cute vibe, too!
author: Lou B.

description: Food that tastes home cooked, healthy, and savory-- from Ethiopia, India, Peru, and who knows where next? I love eating at P-on-3, especially at the big communal table. Off-peak hours, you can work here too. Appreciate the gluten free treats and the unusual vegetable sides. Nothing they serve is conventional, but it's all delicious.
author: tony a.

description: Best kept brunch secret in soma! The French toast was amazing! Friendly staff. I am going back
author: mehdi s.

description: Excellent brunch spot.  Seems like the menu changes often; the two potato hash and prosciutto pancakes were delicious and among the best brunch items I've had in the city.  The French toast and cornmeal were nothing special, but the first two items made up for it.
author: Josh Q.

description: Came here for brunch and it was more than I could've asked for. Our party got one of each: pancakes, scramble, Brussels sprout hash, chili braised pork. Everything was five stars. And the bacon was, wait for it, the best I've ever had. Ever.
author: Jonathan D.

description: LOVE that they're open on the weekends.  Nice staff.  Always smells so tasty when I'm walking by.
author: S. F.

description:
What a breath of fresh air! Not only does the menu change every day but you actually get to see the options before you order. I don't have to imagine a dish from a description and hope that it's what I want.

The portion sizes were generous, ingredients fresh, and flavors balanced - what's not to like about this place?
author: Kevin S.

description:
This is a great addition to the area. It's a tad pricey, but huge portions. The line moves very quickly, and the food is excellent. They are totally set up for takeout at lunch. The menu changes daily. 

They are going to totally take all of my lunch money.
author: robert h.

description: I've been working in the city for about 1.5 months now and previously was surviving on my favorite deli for lunch everyday. But wow have I been missing out by not exploring around a little more. I found out about picnic by eavesdropping in the office and after my co-workers lavished about it I had to try it myself. I got the chicken as the main dish and a side salad for about 11 dollars. For such a big hunk of chicken it was cooked to perfection. They season it well and the meat is tender but juicy. The menu changes each day so I am excited to see what else they have to offer.
author: Matthew L.

description: Do you find yourself eating the same dish every time you go out for lunch? Not an option at Picnic. Their menu is hyper seasonal (changes daily) and that means you're always trying something new.
author: Charlie B.

description: They have a different cuisine and menu everyday, but on this particular day, I went in at 11:30am for a quick lunch catch up with a friend. Oaxacan was on the menu, I ordered the crispy pork belly with a side salad and rice. Of all the places I've ordered pork belly, Picnic on Third took it beyond expectations by a longshot. Crispy, flavorful, but not too obnoxious on the spices. You could still taste all of the natural flavors. Salad and seasoned rice was on point as well. Will definitely come back!
author: Catherine U.

description: Great spot- highly recommend. The cornmeal/polenta pancakes are unique & deelish. Casual & nice atmosohere.
author: Julie M.

description: Loved this place! Came in on NY Day and had brunch. Was lucky enough to experience the Leigh's pancakes AND they have the best bacon! It's great, tasty, fresh food. Jesse, one of the owners, waited on us. I highly recommend and we will definitely be frequenting this little gem!
author: Lauren N.

description: Great new spot for lunch or take home dinner.  I'm gluten free and this place is totally safe and delicious.  Fresh, whole food is in abundance!  The owner Natalia is delightful and the venue design is extremely friendly.  Pick up dinner and wine to make a splendid evening.  I had a cheese platter, charcuterie plate and lentil soup with friends last night.  All was beautifully presented and super tasty.  Their selection of mustards is really awesome.  Loved the lentil soup too.  Enjoyed a glass of the Chardonnay then Pinot Grigio - both super yummy.  I would highly recommend this place to anyone!
author: Charlotte W.

description: What a great place to grab a great bite to eat, sip a delicate cup of espresso, and enjoy the company of friends.  The dishes are unique, fresh, and oh so good.  The aroma from the espresso machine sent my senses tingling.  My espresso drink was rich with flavor and a delight to drink.  The food is enough to bring you back but the espresso was a deal sealer.  The vibrant atmosphere and incredible service completed the dinning experience for me.  This one is a keeper.
author: Alex H.

description: This place is super awesome! It's just got that vibe inside that you want to be there. Excellent staff, amazing food. Considering how much food costs in the city, their prices are quite reasonable (especially for the quality you're getting). I'm definitely going back to check out how the menu changes!
author: Jonathan S.

description:
Food was delicious! Chose the braised beef combination plate off the menu -- Really tender meat, tasty veggies, and excellent portions. Leigh topped the plate with pickled radish (optional) which was a nice touch. Also enjoyed the chai latte. Most of all, loved the vibe of the place. 

Will definitely come back for more! (I only wish they were open on weekends too).
author: Doreen H.

description:
The staff alone is 5-stars - energetic, happy, friendly.

The food was delicious and healthy. I had three sides ($3 each): the roasted eggplant, carrot and radish slaw, and hummus. Oh, also got a pumpkin paleo muffin ($4). Yeah, I know. Don't judge.

The price is reasonable for the area. No, I'm not in the business of having $13 lunches everyday but one could just order a side or two, or a main ($7), and be comfortably sated, or augment it with home-brought stuff. It's hard to stick to, say, one side when there's so much deliciousness in front of you, but you probably are more disciplined than I (hello, pumpkin muffin!).
author: JT W.

description:
Today was my first time visiting Picnic on Third, but it certainly won't be my last.

When I came in today I was greeted by a one of the friend;y staff, who unbeknownst to me was one of the 2 chef/owners.  When you come in Picnic on Third you will be have a choice of three different meals.  All of the ingredients are seasonal and the menu changes every day.  If you want to know in advance what they are serving that day you should consult their website.  I came in today to try their Duck Confit, which was amazing.  Great flavor with wonderfully delicious crunchy skin sprinkled on top. I had the duck with the Vege Plate, as I couldn't just settle for only trying 2 sides as the normal plate with just 2 sides.    

I look forward to coming back here again soon.
author: Mike S.

description: I wish I had just one word but I don't. Here's a few: perfection, delicious, healthy, devine, amazing, clean and really freaking yummy!!!! Come here and eat... If you don't I'll find you ;-)
author: Rich K.

description: You're basically paying 30-40% more for this than for Sprig, which delivers the exact same meal to your door.  Food is high quality and nice assortment of sauces.  Most expensive lunch I've had in the city in a long time for fast casual.  Quick and efficient table cleanup.  Line was a little long, but hey, it's popular.
author: David S.

description: This is our second time to stop for meal on the way to a Giants game. If they continue to impress us we will keep coming back. The menu is limited & constantly changing...but so far very happy with the selections, the quality and the price. Beer selection is nice too. Very clean...simple...and if you are running late they will pack it as a picnic to go...thumbs up!
author: Ginny B.

description:
One star just for the sneaky way they force you to pay a tip. In fact, they don't accept cash and at checkout, their tablet software will be prompting you to giant tip boxes right over your signature. The lowest you can go tapping those boxes is 10%, of course you can manage to go 0% but additional taps are required: go custom, then use the numeric pad.

- use of peer pressure to force you to tip: social engineering 101

America: takeout food should not be tipped (or if it should, I urge you to start tipping cashiers at Safeway). It doesn't matter whether you can afford or not, doing so risks establishing a standard (in addition to being an insult to our intelligence) and above all, it embarrasses people who can't afford.
author: Ho N.

description:
Popped in here for lunch after seeing that their daily dishes were Mediterranean inspired and I was totally blown away. 

The lamb meatballs were super tender, roasted potatoes were crispy on the outside and fluffy in the middle, and the roasted red pepper hummus was to die for. 

Run, don't walk, to this place!!!
author: Jennifer B.

description: Stopped in on my way to work, was warmly greeted by the owner of the shop. Got a delicious and not too-sweet chai that was recommended as well as a granola to go. Price is what you'd expect from a SoMa establishment, and the food was good.
author: Morgan E.

description: Food is decent but overpriced.  I had the veggie plate and it was good, fresh, and well cooked.  I would come back for lunch if only it was a bit less expensive.  The cafe has a comfortable, trendy ambiance and not too crowded at lunch time.  It would make a nice place to meet someone for coffee and light food.
author: Ryan N.

description: This place is a hidden gem.  Being a chef, I must say the food was wonderful.  The cuisine blends perfectly with its name.  The food is well seasoned and they truly perfected each dish they serve.  I will most definitely be back! Good job Picnic on 3rd! This is my new favorite spot.
author: Daniel S.

description: Enjoyed a great beer and wine selection here for a happy hour with friends. Food is spectacular and fast.
author: Scott H.

description: good ambience and very sweet people. when our order seemed to have gotten lost, they apologized profusely and gave us complimentary sides of brown sugar bacon and French toast!
author: Allison P.

description: This place is amazing.  I've tried their lunch, brunch and happy hour and it was all excellent!
author: Daniel M.

description: Fantastic Lunch Spot in SOMA. Always has fresh food, new menu every day with great dishes. Had the Zh'atar Chicken Wings with Kholrabi Cucumber Salad and Bulgar Feta Salad today ($13 total so not the cheapest, but not expensive for quality food) . Very refreshing tasty meal and filling. Will be back next week, and the week after, and the week after...
author: Will P.

description: Came in to duck the rain and get a hot cup of coffee... the counter staff couldn't even be bothered to serve me a $4.50 cup of drip coffee... Pastries and grab and go breakfast items are lacking on multiple visits. Sure I could order breakfast from the menu. That's great that everything "home made"... but honestly I'd rather just make it at home and save my self the insults of a "can't be bothered staff" and overpriced fare. I even tried to pay with a $20 and was asked to pay with a credit card cause they are trying to avoid taking in a "bunch" of cash. Seriously, if you can't break a $20 during breakfast time on a work week when everyone should be popping in to order stuff... means you don't have enough money in the cash drawer due to lack of business. An inconvenience to the customer doesn't make your shop special... just makes you snobby! Not even a thank you have a good day when I left. I won't be back...
author: J R.

description:
So good. I love the quality and freshness of the food here.  The menu changes every day, and each menu offers a variety of inspired dish themes, which I also love as a concept.  If you work in SOMA or South Park, it's fairly easy to walk to. 

I've only come her for lunch, but I plan on checking out breakfast soon.  Last time I came was in December 2014, but I recommend getting there early.  It's a great place for casual meetings over lunch, and a popular place for lunch in general, so I recommend getting there early. 

Looking forward to going back there soon!
author: Nicole C.

description: This is basically the replacement for your Google/Facebook/Billion dollar startup cafeteria with high end balanced lunch cuisine. There's only 3 options that are usually vegetarian, chicken, and pork, but it changes every day and it's always good with some very creative sauces and side dishes that change all the time. You could come here pretty much every day and not get bored for quite some time.
author: Curt B.

description: Great food and excellent service!  Stopped in for a quick bite mid morning - had the salmon snack, sandwich and amazing Aztec spice tea - all was wonderful, fresh and tasty!  Will definitely be back!
author: Heather M.

description: Super-fresh, delicious, creative daily menu. Ambiance is bright and cheerful with a community feel. Great place for a lunch meeting.  Also a nice spot to hunker down and do a little work (probably best during non-peak hours).
author: Carolyn B.

description: This place is absolutely incredible and amazing . I couldn't say much that other people haven't already said, but the food is of such high quality and it's consistently delicious , unique , and FRESH! The tip is : TRY EVERYTHING! You will not be disappointed. It's hard to find legit healthy food in the city at a good price , well folks, here it is!!! Bon apetit! And many thanks to the picnic staff for providing this gem to the city. We need you and my tummy is elated ! Xx
author: Kel F.

description: I was taking to picnic on third for lunch by a co-woker and love it , Very rustic,  hearty,  comfort food and the service was above and beyond A++ ....  But your  mushroom risotto was just a tasteless heavey stodge  and come from a giant rice cooker , But apart from the risotto everything else was top notch ,  No More risotto please ,
author: Toby H.

description:
Excellent fresh food for as little as seven dollars. Quick service and everything is available for take out. I had the wonderful braised lamb. Never had better.

Great and fast service. The staff was professional and friendly.

If you like bread or a roll with your entree, bring some- they do not offer it.

I truly great place for lunch or dinner.
author: Michael T.

description: Nothing but positive things to say about this place!  Not only is their good AMAZING, it is healthy, affordable and absolutely delicious, but the friendly staff always make our lunch experience that much better.  Our company uses them for daily lunch catering and we couldn't be more pleased.  The unique, daily changing  menu offers a variety of satisfying food.  Looking for a healthy & appetizing place to eat? Look no further, you've found a great place!
author: Meghan Z.

description:
DUDE.

This place is some of the freshest, most interesting food in the area! Yeah, ok, Pizza is right around the corner. Don't get me wrong, I love pizza.

But Picnic on Third is fresh, local, and welcoming. I got into a conversation with the woman behind the counter, and it turns out that the 2 owners are award-winning San Francisco chefs! They met at Chez Panisse (OMG - so good), and decided to open their own place.

I had the braised beef and brussel sprouts. Everything was delicious, and so cheap for what you get!

Will definitely be coming back. Don't miss this place!
author: Hannah H.

description:
Not good for vegetarians. 
In today s day and age and that too in progressive sfo ..... Why only one unimaginative veg option
Cold and dry too
For $14 lol. What a world. Lol.
author: Helper P.

description: I had the breakfast sandwich that was unique and very good. Also had the ice coffee with almond milk which I recommend. Cool atmosphere and nice staff!
author: Sam H.

description: This review is about the overall experience in addition to the food. We ordered the two potato hash and the braised pork. The portions are very small. Being a super slow eater, I was able to finish my meal within 15 minutes, that's petty rare. The potato hash was pretty good especially the potatoes were cooked to perfection. The braised pork was tender but not very flavorful. What made us decide to never come back to this place is the noise level. We sat by a large group of people who were yelling and obnoxiously loud throughout their meal which made this brunch experience very unpleasant. If you're looking for a relatively quiet eating place, then this place may not be the best choice.
author: Lulu J.

description: It's a bit pretentious and pricey, but the ingredients seem high quality and fresh, it is nice to not have to choose from too many options, and the changing menus add variety to the experience.
author: Lorem I.

description: Good breakfast sandwich.  Not amazing, but did the trick.  So did the cappuccino.  Disappointed that it didn't have wireless.  I was there for a meeting - and the person was late.  Would have been nice to do some work while I was waiting.  I would try for lunch, but wouldn't go back for another breakfast meeting.
author: Andrew D.

description: The chicken was undercook with blood in the middle. I had stomachache for the rest of the day. Do not recommend it at all...
author: Daisy S.

description:
I don't usually write reviews but I wanted to call this place out because it's awesome. The sides are fresh and tasty, the duck was arguably the best I've ever had, and the coffee was great... oh and it was lunch! I expect that kinda food at a nice dinner spot (which this place prob is as well). 

I also love that the menu changes. I used to work in the area and the local offerings can get pretty stale, but not here. I will definitely be back. 

ps. love the whole layout of the place.
author: Tom F.

description: Wow.  I had been steering clear as coworkers had said the food was fresh and good, but the price was a little high (my takeout lunch today was $14.50).  But man was it good.  Today was an Indian menu, I had a chicken dish with basmati rice and sauteed chard.  It was super fresh and delicious.  I'm a big home cook and it felt just like something I'd cook at home.  I will definitely be back.  The staff is super friendly as well.
author: Brad K.

description:
It is bit hard to rate this restaurant as there are a lot of interesting and good things about it but was underwhelmed by the food itself.
Décor - great. I liked the simple set up, tin plates, the water jars, pickle and spice jars, even the entrance way, with the tin lids nailed on the wall...
Ingredients - obviously high quality and fresh. Nothing looked wilted or cheap - they even had slices of lime next to the water fountain...
Ambiance and service - great. Personnel is polite and obliging, music has the right volume, entertaining without being obnoxious...in one word, very tasteful.
Food and pricing - food is good but did bot blow me away. Pricey - and I do understand that given the quality of ingredients the price is justified. However, at the end of the day, the patron is under the impression that food was overpriced, and I read this in other reviews. Reason is not that you are over the budget - reason is that simply there is a disconnect between what you get and what you pay...
I hope however that the concept can survive because I do understand it is a challenging experience - food quality, SF prices and I did not mention the fact that menu is changing daily which certainly adds another layer of difficulty....
Again, I hope that this concept will survive...
author: VIORICA C.

description: Delicious, reasonably priced lunch. You know how you have that one friend who is a bomb cook and you always jump at the opportunity to eat over? That's what they're serving here. Simple and well executed. I had braised lamb, hummus and roast eggplant. Buddy had roast chicken, carrot salad and couscous. $12 each for big full plates. You can mix and match mains and sides, and there are plenty of veg and gf options. A+ would eat again.
author: maggie g.

description: Picnic on Third is the perfect lunch spot for the neighborhood. The food is superb and a refreshing mix that separates it from the other lunch joints in the area. The menu is gorgeous and made with love and care that is not usually found in the "power lunch" outfits nearby. Picnic sets a new standard for fresh, thoughtful and delicious lunches done right. Definitely check this place out!
author: Eric S.

description: Wow, my first meal at Picnic on Third was truly a delight! No amount of descriptions & sneak previews could have prepared my senses for what lay in store today. As I walked in, my sight was captivated by the upscale yet welcoming design & decorum of the space. Before I could consciously appreciate the ambiance, my sense of smell was uplifted by the plethora of aromae which only furthered my hunger. This led to the best part, as I chose my side dishes of farro verde and roasted winter squash and my main dish of crispy confit duck leg with fig compote. With "just a damn cup of coffee" to wash it all down, I sat at one of the homemade tables to enjoy one of the best meals I've had in quite some time. The food was gourmet in quality, taste, preparation, & presentation, lacking just the small portions & inflated prices one expects to accompany such fine fare (my whole lunch was under $15). The staff was friendly & helpful, explaining the nuisances of their cuisine and providing prompt & efficient service when needed. But in the end, the best part was by far the food. Once I began to dine, I lost all awareness except for the plate in front of me. The meal was nutritionally well-balanced and downright tasty to say the least. As I left, I had to loosen my belt & was left stunned by both the quality & quantity of my rather thrifty lunchscapade. I can't wait for my next picnic... on Third.
author: Matthew P.

description: I'm a fan! We were walking to the train station on New Year's day and it felt like a desolate wasteland. No people, no cars. Emptiness. All of a sudden, we noticed a door open as we passed this establishment on 3rd. I didn't even check yelp for any reviews, we just went in. And we're so glad we did! It was warm, it was bustling, it smelled amazing! We were seated and told our server our train departure time, and we were accommodated graciously. Delicious food, creative choices, helpful staff.  We loved the plates and cups they use and asked where they got them. I immediately ordered some as soon as I got home. We will definitely be back. Thank you Picnic on Third, for allowing us to feast Thursday morning, instead of grabbing a coffee and pastry from just a coffee shop!
author: Robin A.

description: AWESOME and unusual, healthy dishes.  I stopped by last night just before closing time.  I had a delicious butternut squash soup with a "water spinach salad" and pork and white bean stew.  All were perfectly flavored, fresh, and memorable.  And the pear tart for dessert was a nice bonus.  Good, friendly service and comfortable, pleasant decor.  I'll be back (both to take out and to eat in.)
author: Michael N.

description: Delicious food and great concept! In addition to the rotating menu they have a refridgerated case full off homemade soups, picked things, kimchi, and other yummy goodies that you can buy to take home! Love it, I will be back!
author: April M.
